message: I've trialed several of these including Visistat which I found was the most comprehensive but its very expensive for even a low trafficked site
i am surprised you dont use google, it is very robust and can be simple too
@raffi if you want more robust data then you can't beat http://awstats.sourceforge.net/ only downside you have to install it on your actual server
i did use google. its limited and in seeing some of the more robust data that is available. kissmetrics looks interesting. I also came across chartbeat and reinvigorate, anyone use those?
New & upcoming player in this market (looks really good): http://gaug.es
Chartbeat is awesome, though I can assure you you will spend lots of time watching your analytics in real time - it's mesmerising
… but I also use Mint on my personal website (http://haveamint.com)
I rather like Open Web Analytics http://www.openwebanalytics.com/ and Piwik http://piwik.org/ which are both open source and run on your server.
Chartbeat looks interesting especially because they test load times. I'm trialing it but gaug.es pricing looks good too.
we use getclicky for all of the www.LiveFanChat.com sites - love the spy feature.
